sentence: The war cry for justice was all over - Much to the chagrin of the authorities.
Irish: Bhí an caoin cogaidh ar son an cheartais thar - go mór le Chagrin na n-údarás.
backtrans: The cry of war for justice was over - greatly with the chagrin of the authorities.

sentence: The regime's decision adumbrates the underlying agenda.
Irish: Admhaíonn cinneadh an chórais an clár oibre bunúsacha.
backtrans: The system's decision acknowledges the basic agenda.

sentence: The community was anxious over the passing of the much needed reforms.
Irish: Bhí an pobal imníoch thar na hathchóirithe a bhfuil géarghá leo a rith.
backtrans: The public was anxious over the urgently needed reforms.

sentence: The think tank  published a paper outlining their apology of capital punishment.
Irish: D'fhoilsigh an t-umar smaoinimh páipéar ag cur síos ar a leithscéal pionóis chaipitil.
backtrans: The thought tank published a paper describing its capital penalties.

sentence: Aught was left of the petition's validity
Irish: Bhí sé fágtha de bhailíocht na hachainí
backtrans: It was left in the validity of the petition

sentence: The President exhorted his ministers to buckle up as key opposition support for his economic plan was about to buckle.
Irish: Rinne an tUachtarán a airí a spreagadh chun buckle suas mar go raibh tacaíocht fhreasúra lárnach dá phlean eacnamaíoch ar tí dul i ngleic leis.
backtrans: The President encouraged his ministers to buckle up as central opposition support for its economic plan was about to tackle.

sentence: The voters were chuffed to see the bill passed.
Irish: Bhí na vótálaithe sumded chun an bille a rith.
backtrans: Voters were sumded to run the bill.

sentence: The lawyer's discursive narration swayed the jury.
Irish: Suaitheadh narratuithe discréideach an dlíodóra an giúiré.
Chuir an chúirt isteach ar an bhforéigean!
backtrans: The court applied for the violence!

sentence: The EU block opposed an eventual imposition of anti-dumping measures.
Irish: Chuir an bloc an AE i gcoinne bearta frithdhumpála a fhorchur go deireadh.
backtrans: The EU block opposed anti-dumping measures to end.

sentence: A fulsome eulogy was delivered by the sly counsel.
Irish: Sholáthair an t-abhcóide gly an t-abhcóide Fulsome.
backtrans: The Gly Counsel provided the Fulsome advocate.

sentence: The gig-economy agency decided to garnish the refunds!
Irish: Chinn an Ghníomhaireacht Geilleagair Gig-Geilleagar na haisíocaíochtaí a garnish!
backtrans: The Gig-Economy Economy Agency decided to garnish repayments!

sentence: Members of the anti-theocratic revolutionary movement overthrew the peers in power!
Irish: Chuir baill den ghluaiseacht réabhlóideach frith-theocratic leis na comhghleacaithe i gcumhacht!
backtrans: Members of the Revolutionary Antocratic movement with the colleagues in power!

sentence: The traitors disappointingly decided to fight with the colonialists.
Irish: Shocraigh na traitors díomá dul i ngleic leis na coilíneachtaí.
backtrans: These traitors decided to cope with the colonies.
